deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
A Brand registry will keep track of the brands being registered.
 Those brands will hold the metadata, and this trait will hold
 the mean to register such brand with its metadata.
The metaverse that will own this brand registry.

The address that will receive the earnings of the brand
 registration process (when triggered by the public mean).

The cost to register a new brand. This can be changed in
 the future and must be able to be known in the ABI for the
 users to be aware of the statistic. By default, defining
 a brand is disabled by the public mean, until a price is
 set by the administration.

All the registered brands are here. Each brand will have
 a non-empty name and non-empty description. Brands can
 only be added - never deleted / unregistered.

Permission: Superuser (all the permissions are considered
 given to a superuser which is registered in a respective
 non-zero brand). The only things that superuser per-se
 cannot do in a brand are to transfer it via ERC-1155 and
 add more superusers.

(Metaverse-scope) Permission: The user is allowed to set
 the brand registration cost.

(Metaverse-scope) Permission: The user is allowed to set
 the brand social commitment to a brand, or not. Brands with
 that flag set are (1) non-commercial and (2) aligned to this
 metaverse's social commitment views.

(Metaverse-scope) Permission: The user is allowed to mint
 and brand, for an owner, for free.
Permission: The user is allowed to edit a brand's aesthetic.

Maintains the permissions assigned to all the brands
 (the brand must always be != 0).
The count of registered brands.
An event for when the brand registration cost is updated.
An event for when the brand registration earnings receiver is changed.

documentation.text:
Given the appropriate metadata, mints a new brand. The image url
 is mandatory, but about:blank may be used if it is missing or one
 image is not yet ready. The icons are optional. An empty string
 or about:blank should be used if not needed. Ensure all the urls
 are empty (as permitted) or valid urls, and the name and description
 have only json-string-friendly character, no backslash, and no double
 quotes or the metadata might fail to be assembled into valid JSON,
 also taking special care with the name and description, since they
 cannot be changed later.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: brand registration is disabled since no setup is done for the earnings receiver"

arguments.value: BrandRegistry: brand registration is disabled since no setup is done for the earnings receiver

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,address,string memory,string memory,string memory,string memory,string memory,string memory,bool)

documentation.text:
Registers a new brand, when the appropriate price is paid for it.
 For more details on how this method works, check _registerBrand's
 inline documentation.

This event is triggered when a brand is updated with respect
 to its social commitment (this is: to tell a brand is socially
 committed according to the metaverse's views or not). Special
 benefits (in particular, with respect to assets loading on
 customers) are given in clients to socially committed brands.
Updates whether a brand is socially committed or not.

Sets the owner of a brand. This method is meant to be called
 internally, when the actual brand transfer is done (brands
 can only be transferred, but never burnt).

This event is triggered when a brand is registered. The new
 address is also included, along some reference data.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url"

arguments.value: BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url"

documentation.text:
Updates the brand image. Only the owner of the brand or an
 approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _image is
 empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's challenge url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the url
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's 16x16 icon url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's 32x32 icon url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's 64x64 icon url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Assembles the whole metadata for a brand. WARNING: This method
 will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a
 CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other
 contract's code).
Tells whether an address corresponds to a registered brand or not.
A brand registry satisfies the IBrandRegistry and IERC165.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: caller is not brand owner nor approved, and does not have the required permission"

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: caller is not brand owner nor approved, and does not have the required permission"

documentation.text:
Restricts an action to senders that are considered to have
 certain permission in the (non-zero) brand.

documentation.text:
Restricts an action to senders that are considered to have
 certain metaverse-scoped permissions.

Tells whether a user has a specific permission on a specific brand
 or it is allowed by the brand's ownership.

Tells whether the address is a committed brand, or not
 (this may also be caused by the address not being a brand).

This event is triggered when a brand permission is set or revoked
 for a given user in a given brand.

documentation.text:
Grants a permission to a user. This action is reserved to owners,
 approved operators, or allowed superusers. However, superuser cannot
 set, in particular, the SUPERUSER permission itself.
Implements the way for the delegable context to return a metaverse.

A Brand registry will keep track of the brands being registered.
 Those brands will hold the metadata, and this trait will hold
 the mean to register such brand with its metadata.
The metaverse that will own this brand registry.

The address that will receive the earnings of the brand
 registration process (when triggered by the public mean).

The cost to register a new brand. This can be changed in
 the future and must be able to be known in the ABI for the
 users to be aware of the statistic. By default, defining
 a brand is disabled by the public mean, until a price is
 set by the administration.

All the registered brands are here. Each brand will have
 a non-empty name and non-empty description. Brands can
 only be added - never deleted / unregistered.

Permission: Superuser (all the permissions are considered
 given to a superuser which is registered in a respective
 non-zero brand). The only things that superuser per-se
 cannot do in a brand are to transfer it via ERC-1155 and
 add more superusers.

(Metaverse-scope) Permission: The user is allowed to set
 the brand registration cost.

(Metaverse-scope) Permission: The user is allowed to set
 the brand social commitment to a brand, or not. Brands with
 that flag set are (1) non-commercial and (2) aligned to this
 metaverse's social commitment views.

(Metaverse-scope) Permission: The user is allowed to mint
 and brand, for an owner, for free.
Permission: The user is allowed to edit a brand's aesthetic.

Maintains the permissions assigned to all the brands
 (the brand must always be != 0).
The count of registered brands.
An event for when the brand registration cost is updated.
An event for when the brand registration earnings receiver is changed.

 registrar as its owner.

Tells whether a particular user is the owner of the brand id.

This event is triggered when a brand is registered. The new
 address is also included, along some reference data.

arguments.value: BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: this brand cannot be minted now - try again later"

arguments.value: BrandRegistry: this brand cannot be minted now - try again later

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: this brand cannot be minted now - try again later"

documentation.text:
Given the appropriate metadata, mints a new brand. The image url
 is mandatory, but about:blank may be used if it is missing or one
 image is not yet ready. The icons are optional. An empty string
 or about:blank should be used if not needed. Ensure all the urls
 are empty (as permitted) or valid urls, and the name and description
 have only json-string-friendly character, no backslash, and no double
 quotes or the metadata might fail to be assembled into valid JSON,
 also taking special care with the name and description, since they
 cannot be changed later.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: brand registration is disabled since no setup is done for the earnings receiver"

arguments.value: BrandRegistry: brand registration is disabled since no setup is done for the earnings receiver

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: brand registration is disabled since no setup is done for the earnings receiver"

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,address,string memory,string memory,string memory,string memory,string memory,string memory,bool)

documentation.text:
Registers a new brand, when the appropriate price is paid for it.
 For more details on how this method works, check _registerBrand's
 inline documentation.

This event is triggered when a brand is updated with respect
 to its social commitment (this is: to tell a brand is socially
 committed according to the metaverse's views or not). Special
 benefits (in particular, with respect to assets loading on
 customers) are given in clients to socially committed brands.
Updates whether a brand is socially committed or not.

Sets the owner of a brand. This method is meant to be called
 internally, when the actual brand transfer is done (brands
 can only be transferred, but never burnt).

This event is triggered when a brand is registered. The new
 address is also included, along some reference data.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url"

arguments.value: BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: use a non-empty image url"

documentation.text:
Updates the brand image. Only the owner of the brand or an
 approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _image is
 empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's challenge url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the url
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's 16x16 icon url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's 32x32 icon url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Updates the brand's 64x64 icon url. Only the owner of the brand
 or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon
 is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled
 into valid JSON.

Assembles the whole metadata for a brand. WARNING: This method
 will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a
 CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other
 contract's code).
Tells whether an address corresponds to a registered brand or not.
A brand registry satisfies the IBrandRegistry and IERC165.

arguments.value: BrandRegistry: caller is not brand owner nor approved, and does not have the required permission

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: caller is not brand owner nor approved, and does not have the required permission"

documentation.text:
Restricts an action to senders that are considered to have
 certain permission in the (non-zero) brand.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandRegistry: caller is not metaverse owner, and does not have the required permission"

documentation.text:
Restricts an action to senders that are considered to have
 certain metaverse-scoped permissions.

Tells whether a user has a specific permission on a specific brand
 or it is allowed by the brand's ownership.

Tells whether the address is a committed brand, or not
 (this may also be caused by the address not being a brand).

This event is triggered when a brand permission is set or revoked
 for a given user in a given brand.

documentation.text:
Grants a permission to a user. This action is reserved to owners,
 approved operators, or allowed superusers. However, superuser cannot
 set, in particular, the SUPERUSER permission itself.
Implements the way for the delegable context to return a metaverse.

BrandPermissionChanged(address,bytes32,a.notice: This event is triggered when a brand permission is set or revoked for a given user in a given brand.

BrandRegistered(address,address,string,s.notice: This event is triggered when a brand is registered. The new address is also included, along some reference data.

BrandRegistrationCostUpdated(address,uin.notice: An event for when the brand registration cost is updated.

BrandRegistrationEarningsReceiverUpdated.notice: An event for when the brand registration earnings receiver is changed.

BrandSocialCommitmentUpdated(address,add.notice: This event is triggered when a brand is updated with respect to its social commitment (this is: to tell a brand is socially committed according to the metaverse's views or not). Special benefits (in particular, with respect to assets loading on customers) are given in clients to socially committed brands.

BrandUpdated(address,address).notice: This event is triggered when a brand is registered. The new address is also included, along some reference data.

brandEarningsReceiver().notice: The address that will receive the earnings of the brand registration process (when triggered by the public mean).

brandExists(address).notice: Tells whether an address corresponds to a registered brand or not.

brandMetadataURI(address).notice: Assembles the whole metadata for a brand. WARNING: This method will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other contract's code).

brandRegistrationCost().notice: The cost to register a new brand. This can be changed in the future and must be able to be known in the ABI for the users to be aware of the statistic. By default, defining a brand is disabled by the public mean, until a price is set by the administration.

brandSetPermission(bytes,address,bytes32.notice: Grants a permission to a user. This action is reserved to owners, approved operators, or allowed superusers. However, superuser cannot set, in particular, the SUPERUSER permission itself.

constructor.notice: Creating a brand registry requires a valid metaverse registrar as its owner.

isBrandAllowed(address,bytes32,address).notice: Tells whether a user has a specific permission on a specific brand or it is allowed by the brand's ownership.

isCommitted(address).notice: Tells whether the address is a committed brand, or not (this may also be caused by the address not being a brand).

metaverse().notice: The metaverse that will own this brand registry.

onBrandOwnerChanged(address,address).notice: Sets the owner of a brand. This method is meant to be called internally, when the actual brand transfer is done (brands can only be transferred, but never burnt).

registerBrand(bytes,string,string,string.notice: Registers a new brand, when the appropriate price is paid for it. For more details on how this method works, check _registerBrand's inline documentation.

setBrandRegistrationCost(uint256).notice: Sets the new brand registration cost.

setBrandRegistrationEarningsReceiver(add.notice: Set the new brand registration earnings receiver.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: A brand registry satisfies the IBrandRegistry and IERC165.

timeout().notice: The timeout of the signature after the emission. The current block timestamp must be between the emission date and (emission date + timeout), Both including. This setting can be managed by the metaverse deployers.

updateBrandChallengeUrl(bytes,address,st.notice: Updates the brand's challenge url. Only the owner of the brand or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the url is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled into valid JSON.

updateBrandIcon16x16Url(bytes,address,st.notice: Updates the brand's 16x16 icon url. Only the owner of the brand or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled into valid JSON.

updateBrandIcon32x32Url(bytes,address,st.notice: Updates the brand's 32x32 icon url. Only the owner of the brand or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled into valid JSON.

updateBrandIcon64x64Url(bytes,address,st.notice: Updates the brand's 64x64 icon url. Only the owner of the brand or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _icon is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled into valid JSON.

updateBrandImage(bytes,address,string).notice: Updates the brand image. Only the owner of the brand or an approved account can invoke this method. Ensure the _image is empty or a valid URL, or metadata might fail to be assembled into valid JSON.

updateBrandSocialCommitment(address,bool.notice: Updates whether a brand is socially committed or not.

userdoc.notice: A Brand registry will keep track of the brands being registered. Those brands will hold the metadata, and this trait will hold the mean to register such brand with its metadata.
